Articles.Content:
78 matching tonnage at 78.78 and I agree it is getting a bit silly.Mine without the accessories weighs about the same.

EDIT:Iv'e actually been working on them for a while since the cutlass the new rockomax made it worthwhile.

Edited August 10, 2013 by Spartwo

Yeah, I only have 22 missiles... I guess it comes down to how effective your missiles are...

Edit to make it fair I'm gonna launch 78 one ton fighters, would you be OK to that?

Edited August 10, 2013 by zekes

Alright this will be interesting.hmmm I wonder if I can go lower.

Edited August 10, 2013 by Spartwo
What if we both were allowed a noncombat refuel/ rearm ship of any size that could not attack nor be attacked, that way the battle is more realistic and not about who has the most missiles...

I'd say not you would need some docking ports on board and 156 is a lot of rearming.

.5 is definitley possible

Edited August 10, 2013 by Spartwo

That is not a fighter its a .......... tiny thing its too small (Brain Explodes) nice work on getting it less than a ton

No wait i know what it is its basically a two stage guided missile the delivery system and the warhead(also it looks like your sepratrons are straight(could be just the angle though) But you that angled sepratons make the missiles much more accurate right?
Spin stability is on all missiles.1700m/s is good though right.
Sorry didnt realize that they were ever so slightly tilted my bad

but so can we do the Weapons ship idea? I would like to rearm my ships, it would make battles more fun (we wouldn't always be running out of ammo)

also we need to limit the number of craft in a battle to like 30, or at least make it fair in some other way than mass... this is kinda getting dumb. we need to focus on building real weapons not one time use peashooters.

Edited August 10, 2013 by zekes
Seems like all ships that aren't just missiles should be required to have a Kerbal.

Seems like all ships that aren't just missiles should be required to have a Kerbal.

or have a minimum and maximum size...

So have I helped the overbuilding thing you mentioned.The sickle can be refueled/stocked easily.Let's set the limit to 15.

EDIT:why do you change your ships everytime I have you outgunned.

EDIT EDIT:

Why not 4 broadswords VS 3 Drakavaks

resupplies have a limit of full restock and refuel of half the available vehicles.

Edited August 10, 2013 by Spartwo

KIDA's attack left Grey 2 immobile, but its cockpit and missiles remained.

Attempting revenge on the GN-1B, they fired all six smart missiles and landed one hit...

A few missiles were busted and a couple engines fell off, but the great ship was still in the game.

Having exhausted all their ammo, the pilots Elsel and Nelsel were forced to sound the surrender.

Victory goes to KIDA.
Daemoncaptrix: You can change your location now You have most definitely left the planet Eve :L
I still have KS9 in high orbit.

I still have KS9 in high orbit.

I may try to capture that intact. It would save hauling a new station over there

i may try to capture that intact. It would save hauling a new station over there

Pirate!

So have I helped the overbuilding thing you mentioned.The sickle can be refueled/stocked easily.Let's set the limit to 15.

EDIT:why do you change your ships everytime I have you outgunned.

EDIT EDIT:

Why not 4 broadswords VS 3 Drakavaks

resupplies have a limit of full restock and refuel of half the available vehicles.

ok ill go with that... i like that, would be very interesting. Very gentlemanly

You place yours first, and ill attack first. That way first turn advantage will be negated by my having one less ship.

seeing that both kida's and daecorp's weapons are totally useless, daecorp has sent a shipment of modern weaponry to ks9, an orbital ore processing station in high orbit above eve. The fleet has retreated to rendezvous with the weapons and rearm for a second engagement with kida, hoping to complete the refit before kida can do likewise.

holy s*** deep space nine is ksp :,,,)

persist:http://www./download/tv83e2euobsyexy/persistent.sfs

The long term cluster stood in orbit a few veterans were there Broadsword-1/2/3 and the newest edition only known as redshirt joining them was a resupply station holding enough resorces for 2 empty Broadswords.

The Trio is back! Thresher, Drekevak, and Skrillex and the warweary 12th assemble again to defend Ike.

The last ship in the Tekkan line was obliterated. Scratch-One for Skrillex.

Should you be calling a ship a 'redshirt'?

No because redshirts always die.

I love how the panels survived, strange irony the weakest peices survive :)This battle is going awfully well im enjoying it, its very evenly matched.
